content.description: Super steep bouldery route up the steepest section of the wall. Powerful moves up sloping crimps to a big throw to a jug before linking up with 40 Feet To Freedom. It's pretty nice to pre-clip both bolts to keep the belayer out of the way. You can somewhat TR the meat of the route from the anchors of Abandonment Issues, massive but safe swing.
content.protection: Six bolts I think? Clip the first short and the third one long. Chains

content.description:
Powerful moves up a very steep wall with positive holds. Most people inadvertently cut feet on this one, which adds to the excitement.

Right off the start, huck a huge throw to a good incut edge. A few more steep moves on finger jugs land you at the very fun heel hook traverse that leads you to "Abandonment Issues". Clip the fourth bolt long.

I recently added a bolt between the first and (original) second bolt because it was brought to my attention people were not finding the clipping jug and getting spooked off it. LOTL is meant to be fun, so now there's no worry on this thing. Get on it!
content.protection: Six draws. chains and lower off biners

content.description: Very fun climb with excellent hidden incut edges. Another perfect route for the new leader. One of the "Bolted Moderates" mentioned in the Bigfoot Guide, name unknown.
content.location: Go to the Far Out Wall, and continue wrapping left around the rock. Routes are hidden around the corner. This one is 20' right of the obvious arete.

content.description: Exciting pumpy moves up and right land on a giant jug and easier ground above. A new bolt has been placed at the start in an appropriate clipping location with solid rock to protect the crux from groundfall, stick clip no longer needed.
content.location: five feet right of the leftward tree.

content.description: Great introduction to lead. 40 feet of nice edges. One of the "Bolted Moderates" mentioned in the Bigfoot Guide, name unknown.
content.location: Far left of a separate wall one minute around the corner from the main Far Out Wall.

climbs.name: Abandonment Issues
climbs.fa: Rick Shull TR Evan Wisheropp FL

content.description: The top half of this climb had been bolted, then seemed to have been abandoned before the bottom half got done. This route was just too good to go abandoned like that, so I've finished it up with a few bolts at the start. It begins with a super steep overhang with massive jugs and big reaches. It is definitely one of the best 5.10- routes at LOTL.  Clip the first two long if you can (slings). I've heard grades from 5.9 to 5.10b, so please post your grade.
content.protection: 5 bolts, chains and lower off biners
content.location: Obtuse dihedral near the middle of the wall.
